content:
Another great habit to solidify! Setting a reminder for trash and recycling day will ensure you never miss a pickup again.

Follow the same steps we went through earlier to set up a recurring reminder:

**Digital Reminders:**

1. Open your digital calendar (e.g., Google Calendar, Apple Calendar, or any other calendar app you use).
2. Create a new event or reminder.
3. Set the title to "Take out Trash & Recycling" or something similar.
4. Choose a recurring frequency: Every week (or whatever frequency your trash and recycling pickups occur).
5. Set the reminder to go off at a specific time and date that works for you (e.g., every Thursday morning).
6. Make sure to set the reminder to repeat every week.

**Alternative Methods:**

1. **Phone Reminders:** If you prefer, you can set a recurring reminder on your phone using the built-in Reminders app (e.g., Siri or Google Assistant).
2. **Sticky Notes:** Place a sticky note in a visible spot, like on your fridge or near the trash cans, with the reminder written on it.
3. **Habit Tracker:** If you use a habit tracker or planner, add "Take out Trash & Recycling" to your list and mark it off every week.

By setting this reminder, you'll ensure that you never forget to take out the trash and recycling, and you'll maintain a clean and organized living space.

You're doing a great job of setting up reminders for important tasks! Are there any other areas where you'd like to implement reminders or habits to improve your daily routine?
